--- title: "NEOF Tidyverse" ---

This is a resource for the R Tidyverse suite of packages. It is intended as a quick one-stop reference for the various tidyverse packages and their functions, also known as a cookbook. This website does not go into great details rather it provides: - Concise explanations - Quick examples - Links to the official documentation This webpage is split into sections for each of the main packages in tidyverse. These are: - [tibble](/tibble/tibble.qmd): A new and improved data frame-like object - [dplyr](/dplyr/dplyr.qmd): data manipulation, also introduces the tidyverse pipe (`|>`) - [readr](/readr/readr.qmd): Read in tabular data - [tidyr](/tidyr/tidyr.qmd): Tidying tibbles, includes going from wide to long tibbles/data frames - [ggplot2](/ggplot2/ggplot2.qmd): Visualisation with the grammar of graphics - [stringr](/stringr/stringr.qmd): String manipulation - [forcats](/forcats/forcats.qmd): Factor manipulation - [purrr](/purrr/purrr.qmd): Functions & vectors - [lubridate](/lubridate/lubridate.qmd): Data-time data ## Reading order If you are starting out with Tidyverse I recommend reading through the website in the above order. The above sections can be grouped into the following chapters: - Fundamental Tidyverse: [tibble](/tibble/tibble.qmd), [dplyr](/dplyr/dplyr.qmd), and [readr](/readr/readr.qmd). - Plot generation: [tidyr](/tidyr/tidyr.qmd) & [ggplot2](/ggplot2/ggplot2.qmd). - Miscellaneous: [stringr](/stringr/stringr.qmd), [forcats](/forcats/forcats.qmd), [purrr](/purrr/purrr.qmd), and [lubridate](/lubridate/lubridate.qmd). ## Package names To keep consistent we will include the package name of each function used in code. This is carried out like below. __Note:__ Don't run the below command ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} #Use as_tibble function from tibble package tibble::as_tibble() ``` ::: ## Installation & loading Ensure you have tidyverse installed and loaded before running commands within the rest of these materials. You can install all the tidyverse packages with the following command: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} install.packages("tidyverse") ``` ::: Once installed you can load the package suite: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library("tidyverse") ``` ::: ## External links - [Tidyverse homepage](https://www.tidyverse.org/) - [Cheatsheets](https://rstudio.github.io/cheatsheets/) - [R for Data Science (2e)](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/): If you want a more structured course this is a good place to start.
